column2: $x_{1}$ reflects the Northern Dynasties culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.

column6: Also: x2 is a x3-learner; x3 covers topics x4. Describes the whole learning process, as opposed to 'atomic' knowledge acquisition, as implied by {cilre}; that process can even span years (if not x2's life). The 'atoms' can be drawn out of this word with x4, which can be a {du'u} abstraction (which really is {cilre}2), but also a smaller 'molecule' described with {si'o} (or not). Borrowing from Japanese (勉強).

This word could be used along the lines of other cultural gismu: x1 reflect Laurasian culture/lifestyle/"nationality" in aspect/nature x2. Confer: {pangaio}, {gonduana}, {bemro}, {ropno}, {xazdo}

column6: Also anything longer than four syllables of "blo" (rafsi of the gismu {bloti}). The test of building lujvo like these helps distinguish between lujvo building algorithms in polynomial time from those in exponential time, especially given that {bloti} has five rafsi. For example, the sozysozbot jvozba will take a significant amount of time to build the lujvo from eight {bloti}. See also: {bloti}.

$x_1$ is the whole region of space which is between inner sphere $x_2$ and outer sphere $x_3$.
column6: $x_1$ {canlu}. The two spheres need not be mutually concentric, but $x_3$ should enclose at least some portion (and probably: most) of $x_2$ and, without loss of generality, $x_3$ should be radially larger than or congruent to $x_2$; if $x_2$ is not fully enclosed by $x_3$, then the result is the convex hull formed by them or some smoothed version or inflation thereof, minus every point enclosed by $x_2$ (and possibly minus $x_2$ itself). Containment, by $x_1$, of any points belonging to the (surfaces) of $x_2$ or $x_3$ is left vague and may be specified by additional description. Contrast with "{jinrcaibyca'u}", which a thin toroidal region enclosed by a bolbi'i (under the assumption of nesting: $x_2$ being wholly enclosed by $x_3$) and confined approximately to a plane intersecting therewith (and which nearly requires complete enclosure of $x_2$ by $x_3$). Just use "{jbini}" with a path or interval defined by the centers or mutually-nearest surface points of $x_2$ and $x_3$ if $x_2$ is not at least partially enclosed by $x_3$. Use "{neryrelbolbi'i}" if you want to be extremely clear in meaning.

$k_1$ amply overlaps with $k_2$ at locus $k_3$, amply as compared with standard/norm $b_3$.
$k_1$ is numerous on a scale of $k_3$.
$b_1$=$c_1$ is a mountain in terrain $c_2$, big by standard $b_3$.
$c_1$ is a large (more than two syllables) structure word of grammatical class $c_2$ with meaning/function $c_3$
$z_1$ is bigger than $z_2$ in dimension $b_2$ by margin $z_4$.
$m_1$ is smaller/[less big] than $m_2$ in dimension $b_2$ by margin $m_4$.
$x_1$ is a big cat of Family Felidae of species $x_2$
column6: Genus {pantera} - 'Panthera (roaring or great cats)': {tigra} - 'Tiger, Panthera tigris Asia', {cinfo} - 'Lion, Panthera leo (Africa, Gir Forest in India)', {djagu'ara} - 'Jaguar, Panthera onca (the Americas)', {pardu} - 'Leopard, Panthera pardus (Asia and Africa)'. Genus Acinonyx: {ingulule} - 'Cheetah, Acinonyx jubatus (Africa and Iran)'. Genus Puma: {parpuma} - 'Cougar, Puma concolor (North and South America)'. Genus {unki} - 'Uncia': {irbisa} - 'Snow Leopard, Uncia uncia (mountains of central and south Asia)'. Genus Neofelis: {iunbau} - 'Clouded Leopard, Neofelis nebulosa (southeast and south Asia)', {di'ardi} - 'Sunda Clouded Leopard, Neofelis diardi (Borneo and Sumatra)'

column2: $k_1$ is measured as $k_2$=$s_1$=$b_1$ (quantifier) tablespoon(s).
$c_1$ is a bur/burr/mossycup oak (Quercus macrocarpa) of species/strain $c_2$ with acorns $g_3$.
$x_1$ is a grapefruit/shaddock/pomelo of variety $x_2$.

$x_1$ (text) is a lujvo with meaning $x_2$ and arguments $x_3$, and which is constructed from tanru/veljvo $x_4$ such that at least one element of the veljvo is ultimately not a cmavo (including "{zei}", "{ke}"/"{ke'e}", "{bo}", etc.), gismu, or rafsi of such cmavo or gismu.
column6: This is a {lujvo} which is not a {cmapagjvo}. In particular, if any of the ultimate constitutents of its veljvo involve a {cmevla} or {zi'evla}/{zevla}, then the resulting lujvo is a brapagjvo. This term is mutually exclusive with "cmapagjvo".

column2: $p_1$ is a cauldron/big pot for contents $p_2$, of material/properties $p_3$, big as compared with standard/norm $b_3$.
$d_1$=$b_1$ is a continent in ocean/on planet $d_3$.
$x_1$ ("ra'oi"-quote) is a long (unreduced) rafsi/combining form of word/concept $x_2$ in language $x_3$.
column6: In Lojban, these exist only for gismu and maybe zi'evla and are the four- or five-letter rafsi (where the final "-y" is not counted as a letter in the four-letter case, and may or may not be considered to be part of the rafsi itself). Compare: "{cmarafsi}".

column2: $t_1$=$b_1$ is the biggest among set/range $t_4$ in property/dimension $b_2$ (ka).
$r_1$ is a boulder/big rock of type/composition $r_2$ from location $r_3$, big as compared with standard/norm $b_3$.
$x_1$ is a greater noctule bat (Nyctalus lasiopterus)
$s_1$ is steep with angle $s_2$ to horizon/frame $s_3$.
$m_1$=$b_1$ is very big/great/huge/enormous in the property of $b_2$(ka) as compared with standard/norm $b_3$.
$x_1$  is a Giant onion (Allium giganteum) of variety/breed $x_2$.
$t_1$ is a tone high in pitch/frequency from source $t_3$.
$ba_1$=$br_1$ is a hail stone.
$c_1$=$b_1$ hails to $c_2$ from $c_3$.
$v_1$ is a large container, containing $v_2$, large as compared with standard/norm $b_3$.
$x_1$=$b_1$ is an ocean on planet $x_2$ (default Earth) of fluid $x_3$.
$x_1$=$b_1$ is a cart/dray/draft horse of breed $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a mansion/manor/large house of/for $x_2$, big by standard $x_3$
$z_1$=$b_1$ grows in property $b_2$ (ka) by amount $z_3$.
$g_1$ causes $z_1$=$b_1$ to increase in property/dimension $b_2$ (ka) by amount $z_3$.
$r_1$=$b_1$ is a rose (Rosa gigantea) of species/strain $r_2$.
$g_1$ prepares/readies $b_1$ for $b_2$.
$b_1$ snarls/growls/roars the threat (utterance) of idea/action $s_2$ at audience $s_3$.
$s_1$=$c_1$ is an idea/concept/thought that is potentially harmful to $c_2$ under conditions $c_3$.
column6: The being put in jeopardy by the concept is not necessarily the thinker of the concept. For example, the concept of a certain type of terrorist act is not (only) dangerous to the would-be terrorist. 'Thought hazard' has a broader meaning than 'informational hazard' and 'knowledge hazard' ({capselju'o}, {junckape}, {capfatci} or {facyckape} – closely related words), which have to do with dangerous ideas that are true. [See Bostrom (2011).] Synonymous with {sibyckape}, which some may prefer.
column7: dangerous idea;dangerous thought;harmful idea;ideational hazard;thought hazard

column2: $s_1$ (agent) threatens/menaces idea/action $s_2$ to audience $s_3$.
time tense: is going to, is now just about to, is now anticipating; (tense/modal).
$x_{1}$ is a cart/carriage/wagon [wheeled vehicle] for carrying $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ turns about vector $x_2$ towards direction $x_3$, turning angular distance / to face point $x_4$
column6: Also revolve (= {jincarna}).  See also {gunro}, {jendu}. New definition of {carna} originally proposed by Robin Lee Powell and backward-compatible with the old one. Official definition: $x_1$ turns/rotates/revolves around axis $x_2$ in direction $x_3$.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a chart/diagram/map of/about $x_{2}$ showing formation/data-points $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ rains/showers/[precipitates] to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is precipitation [not limited to 'rain'].
$x_{1}$(s) (mass normally, but 1 individual/jo'u possible) discuss(es)/talk(s) about topic/subject $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [agent] shoves/pushes $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$.
column6: Move by pushing/shoving (= {ca'ermuvgau}).  (cf. {danre} for non-agentive force, {lacpu})

column2: $x_{1}$ looks at/examines/views/inspects/regards/watches/gazes at $x_{2}$.
column6: Also look through (= {grecta}, {ravycta}, {bacycta}); note that English "look" often means a more generic "observe".  See also {jvinu}, {minra}, {simlu}, {viska}, {lanli}, {zgana}, {setca}, {viska}.

column2: $x_{1}$ has authority/is an official in/on/over matter/sphere/persons $x_{2}$ derived on basis $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) kills/slaughters/murders $x_{2}$ by action/method $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is shallow in extent in direction/property $x_{2}$ away from reference point $x_{3}$ by standard $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ launches/fires/shoots projectile/missile $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$ [propellant/propulsion].
column6: Also: $x_1$ is a gun/launcher/cannon; $x_1$ hurls/throws/casts (more general than renro in that propulsion need not be internal to $x_1$).  See also {renro}, {danti}, {jakne}, {jbama}, {spoja}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a community/colony of organisms $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an era/epoch/age characterized by $x_{2}$ (event/property/interval/idea).
column6: ($x_2$ interval should be the defining boundaries; if merely a characterizing period, the nature of the interval should be expressed in an abstract bridi, or the interval should be marked with tu'a; $x_2$ may also be characteristic object(s) or practices of the era, if marked with tu'a); See also {ranji}, {temci}, {citsi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ varies/changes in property/quantity $x_{2}$ (ka/ni) in amount/degree $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$.
column6: Non-resultative, not-necessarily causal change.  (cf. cenba which is non-resultative, galfi which is resultative and causal, stika which is non-resultative and causal; stodi, zasni, binxo)

column2: $x_{1}$ is holy/sacred to person/people/culture/religion/cult/group $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a hundredth [1/100; $10^{-2}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is an heir to/is to inherit $x_{2}$ (object/quality) from $x_{3}$ according to rule $x_{4}$.
column6: Pedantically, inheriting an object should be a sumti-raising (tu'a if non-abstract in $x_2$) of inheriting loka ponse the object - the ownership of the object (= {posycerda}, {posyselcerda} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {jgina}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a morning [dawn until after typical start-of-work for locale] of day $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
column6: This morning (= {cabdeicerni}); tomorrow morning (= {bavlamcerni}); yesterday morning (= {prulamcerni}, {prulamdeicerni}) See also {vanci}, {murse}, {tcika}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is an expert/pro/has prowess in/is skilled at $x_{2}$ (event/activity) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the god/deity of people(s)/religion $x_{2}$ with dominion over $x_{3}$ [sphere]; $x_{1}$ is divine.
column6: Also divinity; $x_2$ religion refers to the religious community as a mass.  See also {censa}, {krici}, {lijda}, {malsi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ [state/event/process] commences/initiates/starts/begins to occur; (intransitive verb).
$x_{1}$ is a work of fiction about plot/theme/subject $x_{2}$/under convention $x_{2}$ by author $x_{3}$.
column6: Also story, lie, untrue.  See also {cukta}, {lisri}, {prosa}, {fatci}, {jitfa}, {jetnu}, {xanri}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (property - ka) is a flaw/fault/defect in $x_{2}$ causing $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a wedge [shape/form/tool] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (event/state) confuses/baffles $x_{2}$ [observer] due to [confusing] property $x_{3}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ is blood/vital fluid of organism $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is cyan/turquoise/greenish-blue [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ is food/feed/nutriment for $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is edible/gives nutrition to $x_{2}$.
location tense relation/direction; forwards/to the front of ...
{claxu} modal, 1st place                            lacked by ...
non-logical connective: set link, unordered; "and also", but forming a set.
2-word letteral/shift: the word following indicates a new font (e.g. italics, manuscript).
links terms into an afterthought termset.
digit/number: % percentage symbol, hundredths.
selbri variable assignment; assigns broda series pro-bridi to a selbri.
non-logical connective: ordered sequence link; "and then", forming a sequence.
pseudo-quantifier binding a variable within an abstraction that represents an open place.
digit/number: 3 (digit) [three].
$x_1$ is a group of people who love each other in a sexual or non-sexual way, which includes the individuals $x_2$, $x_3$, $x_4$, $x_5$, etc., etc., etc.
column6: The most common {celdi} is a couple, but the word also covers polyamorous collectives, polygyny, polyandry, etc. Could even cover {lanzu}. Proposed rafsi is -cle-.

column2: $x_1$ pertains to the Shinto culture/religion/ethos in aspect $x_2$
$x_1$ [dimensionful number] is the (relative) phase (difference) in oscillatory system $x_2$ relative to zero mark $x_3$ under conditions/by standard $x_4$
column6: Can be used for waves, pendula, track races, etc.

column2: $j_1$ is careful of $j_2$=$c_1$, which is dangerous to $c_2$ under conditions $c_3$
$x_1$ is a propeller
$b_1$=$c_1$ is a tornado/waterspout moving from direction $b_2$ at speed $b_3$ rotating around centre /eye $c_2$ with rotational  direction $c_3$.
$ca_1$=$cn_1$ is a drill [rotating, bladed digging tool] for digging $cn_2$
$l_1$ reels in $l_2$=$c_1$ by handle/at locus $l_3$ by rotating it around axis $c_2$.
$cr_1$=$ca_1$ turns to face $cr_2$.
$cu_1$ is a roller skate/ice skate for feet $cu_2$, of material $cu_3$, for carrying $x_4$=$ca_2$.
$k_1$ is $k_2$ (quantifier, default: one) cartloads/wagonloads in quantity.
$x_1$ turns $x_2$ around axis $x_3$ in direction $x_4$.
$k_1$ is a rotary saw [rotating cutting tool] cutting/splitting/dividing $k_2$ (object) into pieces $k_3$
$x_1$ drills material $x_2$ out of $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a Rubik's toy, being of shape/solid $x_2$ with sides $x_3$ and degrees of freedom $x_4$, made from/composed of $x_5$.
column6: This word may be mildly dispreferred to {carkemkasygaukepyblikemkeitci}. $x_2$ is not restricted to three-dimensional objects (despite the definition of {bliku}). Degrees of freedom should be descriptive (not just a number which counts how many there are); so, $x_4$ would be a list of possible moves available.

column2: $x_1$ is a Rubik's toy, being of shape/solid $x_2$ with sides $x_3$ and degrees of freedom $x_4$, made from/composed of $x_5$.
column6: $x_2$ is not restricted to three-dimensional objects (despite the definition of {bliku}). Degrees of freedom should be descriptive (not just a number which counts how many there are); so, $x_4$ would be a list of possible moves available.

column2: $x_1$ is a whirligig beetle of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ feels dizzy
$x_1$ is a helicopter for carrying $x_2$, propelled by $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a flywheel storing energy $x_2$.
column6: A flywheel stores energy by rotating.

column2: $m_1$ is a bike/bicycle/tricycle/pedal vehicle carrying $m_2$ in/on surface/medium $m_3$, propelled by force $m_4$ transmitted via pedal(s) $c_1$=$v_1$.
column6: Also include hydrocycle (={jaurcarvrama'e} or x3= "lo djacu"), handcycle (x4= "lo xance"), electric bicycle (= "lo carvrama'e be fo si'u lo dicymatra"; not to be confused with motorcycles), cycles with different numbers of wheels and different numbers of riders, etc.

column2: $c_1$ is a bike/cycle trailer for carrying $c_2$, propelled by bike/(moped) $l_1$=$c_3$.
$x_1$ is a rainforest
column6: Prefer the lower scoring form {cavrictu'a}. See also {carvi}, {rictu'a}.

$m_1$ orders $m_2$ to have $c_2$ executed by action/method $c_3$.
column7: condemn to death;order execution;sentence to death

column2: $x_1$ is a hitman.
$cl_1$=$ci_1$ (misses / emotionally feels the lack of) $cl_2$=$ci_3$.
$x_1$ is sad that they lack $x_2$ (ka); $x_1$ misses $x_2$.
$x_1$ is barely $x_2$ (property of $x_1$); $x_1$ has barely / almost doesn't have property $x_2$
$x_1$ is an ellipsis character ("…")
$g_1$ (person/agent) deprives $c_1$ of $c_2$.
$r_1$=$g_1$ is a rainmaking/ ritual intended to invoke rain $r_2$=$g_2$, by custom/in community$r_3$, with form/rules$r_4$.
column6: Rainmaking is an ethnographic term for rituals intended to invoke rain. Raindancing (=lo nu cavgari'i dansu).

column2: $l_1$ (agent) showers $l_2$.
$x_1$ is a shower head/faucet/nozzle made of material $x_2$ with flow rate $x_3$ and water pressure $x_4$
column6: see {carvi} {lumci} {tutci} For sprinklers or other water tools use {cavytci}

column2: $f_1$ is a rain forest with trees $t_1$.
$x_1$ is a rainforest.
$f_1$=$c_1$, consisting of $f_2$,  pours into $f_3$=$c_2$ from $f_4$=$c_3$.
$k_1$ is a raincoat of material $k_2$, protecting from rain $c_1$.
$l_1$=$s_1$ (agent) showers itself of soil/contaminant $l_3$ with cleaning material(s) $l_4$.
$x_1$ actualizes $x_2$ (nu); $x_1$ makes $x_2$ actually happen; $x_1$ makes $x_2$ a reality
$f_1$ is actual (existing in act or reality, not just potentially).
$f_1$ is rotten/decayed/fermented with decay/fermentation agent $f_2$.
$x_1$ is currently/actively/actually (rather than latently/potentially/habitually) exhibiting property $x_2$ (ka).
$k_1$ believes (without evidence/proof) that the god/deity $c_1$ exists.
$x_1$ is the incarnation/avatar of god $x_2$ of religion $x_3$
$d1$ does not know if a god(s) exist; d1 is agnostic.
$x_{1}$ is a/the habitation/dwelling/house of god $x_{2}$.
$s1$ has doubts about the existence of a deity/deities.
$s_1$ is theology/science of/about gods/concepts of god $c_1$=$s_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.
$x_1$=$s_1$ is an idol/a sign/symbol representing god/demon/property $x_2$=$s_2$ to observer $x_3$=$s_3$
$z_1$ is the Heaven of religious community $c_2$.
$g_1$=$c_2$ is an arrow made of $g_2$ fired/launched by $c_1$.

$g_1$ (person/mass) attacks with a projectile weapon/shoots victim $g_2$ with goal/objective $g_3$ using launcher/gun $c_1$ which launches/fires/shoots projectile/missile $c_2$ propelled by propellant/propulsion $c_3$.
$x_1$ is December of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_1$=$n_1$ is a firefight/gunfight/gun-battle/duel between combatants $x_2$=$d_1$ and $x_3$=$d_2$ over issue $x_4$=$d_3$ (abstract).
column6: {celxacnunda'a} is synonymous. For the classic pistol duel once common in Europe and the Americas, see {celkemvilnunjivna}/{celxackemvilnunjivna}.

column2: $xa_1$=$c_1$ is a gun/cannon/firearm for use against $xa_2$ by $xa_3$, launching projectile $c_2$ propelled by $c_3$.
column6: jvajvo; Gismu deep structure is "cecla gi'e xarci".

column2: $x_1$ is the society / community system of $x_2$ (society members, exhaustive)
$s_1$ is the science of community systems/ societies based on methodology $s_2$
column6: $s_1$ refers to sociology in the sense of the study of societies. For the study of social behavior see {jikske}. See also {cemci'e}, {saske}.

column2: $l_1$=$c_1$ is a tribe with members including $l_1$ according standard $l_3$.
$s1$ pertains to community $s2$=$c2$
column6: Cultural gismu replacement lujvo for communities: From gismu {cecmu} and {srana}

column2: $x_1$ is $x_2$ percent of $x_3$ in dimension/aspect $x_3$.
$l1$=$c1$ is $l2$ centiliter(s)/centilitre(s) [metric unit] in volume (default is 1) by standard $l3$
$d1$ is $d2$ full (centi)milidays (hundred-thousandth of a day unit) in duration (default is 1 (centi)miliday) by standard $d3$; d1 is a metric second.
column6: For use with metric time system. (It is not proper in the standard metric system to combine prefixes, but lojban's grouping rules allow for it.)

column2: $m_1$=$c_1$ is $m_2$=$c_2$ centimeter(s) / hundredth(s) of a meter [metric unit] in length (default 1) measured in direction $m_3$=$c_3$ by standard $x_4$=$m_3$.
$d_1$ is $d_2$ full centidays (hundredth of a day unit) in duration (default is 1 centiday) by standard $d_3$
column6: For use with metric time system.

column2: $x_1$ breakfasts on breakfast $x_2$
$m_1$=$c_1$ is the dawn of day $m_2$=$c_2$ at location $m_3$=$c_3$.
$ca_1$ is matutinal/active during the pre-dawn/early morning $ce_1$=$m_1$.
$s_1$ (mass) is a breakfast composed of dishes including $s_2$.
$r_1$ blesses/sanctifies $c_1$ in the name of person/people/culture/religion/cult/group $c_2$ under conditions $r_3$.

$cu_1$=$ce_1$ is a holy book containing work $cu_2$ by (presumed) author $cu_3$ for audience $cu_4$=$ce_2$ preserved in medium $cu_5$.
$s_1$ is hieralogy/science of/about sacreds/sacredness $c_1$=$s_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.
$s_1$=$c_1$ is a holy site to person/people/culture/religion/cult/group $c_2$.
$x_1$ is saintly/holy by moral standard/religion $x_2$
$cmene_1$ is a Divine Name of $cevni_1$=$cmene_2$ as known by $cevni_2$=$cmene_3$ which is associated with $cevni_3$; $cmene_1$ is a name of god.
$b_1$ is entirely in the future of $b_2$; $b_1$ begins after $b_2$.
$g_1$ notices $g_2$ by means $g_3$ under condition $g_4$=$c_1$.
$x_1$=$g_1$ (person/agent) initiates/begins/starts/causes the beginning of $x_2$=$c_1$ (state/event/process).
$p_1$ is preliminary to $c_1$=$p_2$'s beginning.
$r_1$ is/are the ritual/proceedings for starting/commencing $c_1$[event/state/process] by community $r_2$ with rules $c_4$.

$s_1$ powers up $s_2$ for function $s_3$=$c_1$.
$x_1$ is the preamble/introduction to $x_2$
$x_1$ sits down on $x_2$.
column6: Cf. {co'a}, {cfari}, {zutse}, {nitytse}, {tsebi'o}. Simple {zutse} refers to the act of sitting, whereas cfatse means the act of beginning to sit.

column2: $xa_1$=$d_1$ is the middle finger of hand $xa_2$=$d_2$ attached to body $d_3$.

column6: 'stage 3 fu'ivla' is a term specific to Lojban and described in 'The Complete Lojban Language', chapter 4, section 7. The definition is similar to that of {fu'ivla}, but with the x3 place of {fu'ivla} omitted. x1 is assumed to be a word in Lojban as the concept doesn't make much sense for other languages. See also {pavyfu'ivla} - 'stage 1 fu'ivla', {relfu'ivla} - 'stage 2 fu'ivla' and {vonfu'ivla} - 'stage 4 fu'ivla'

pro-sumti: definitional terbri variable 1; $x_1$
column6: May be used to define words with {cei'e}, or to talk about definitions of existing or proposed words. Series: {bo'a} {bo'e} {bo'i} {bo'o} {bo'u}

column2: convert number into pro-sumti: definitional terbri variable with associated number; $x_n$
non-logical connective: in superposition with
column6: Useful for Schrodinger's cat, waves, interaction fields, etc. Using normal English conjunction, we say that Schrodinger's cat is both alive AND dead, but this is not exactly true: it is in a state which is the superposition of the living 'eigenstate' and the dead 'eigenstate'.

column2: pro-sumti: definitional terbri variable 2; $x_2$
column6: May be used to define words with {cei'e}, or to talk about definitions of existing or proposed words. Series: {bo'a} {bo'e} {bo'i} {bo'o} {bo'u}

column2: single Lojban-word name quote, turns to selbri-unit: "$x_1$ is that which has this name"
column6: Similar to {ze'oi}, but specifically used for names. Convenient for tanru with {brivycme} and grammars with brivla-cmevla merge, to avoid having to wrap a single word up in "{me} {la} ... {ku}".

column2: pro-sumti: definitional terbri variable 3; $x_3$
column6: May be used to define words with {cei'e}, or to talk about definitions of existing or proposed words. Series: {bo'a} {bo'e} {bo'i} {bo'o} {bo'u}

column2: unary mekso operator: immediately convert number into a single digit.
immediately convert symbolic string to number (explicit)
mekso operator/function terminator (in Polish notation): inserts exactly enough "{boi}"'s consecutively so as to terminate the most recently uttered operator/function in a mekso expression
column6: Encloses the operator and all of its explicitly mentioned operands within a pair of mekso parenthesis ({vei} and {ve'o} respectively).  All operand slots that have not already been explicitly filled are now (implicitly) filled by the default operand, {xo'ei} (which itself is taken to behave in its default mode), or the identity element under that operator/function in that position/role (in the sense that 0 or 1 is identity under exponentiation as the position/role of being the base but only 1 is identity for exponentiation in the exponent position/role).  Operators of arbitrary arity (such as {su'i}) are terminated immediately after the most recently explicitly mentioned operand. If the character string/digraph "eu" (and a corresponding diphthong) ever becomes valid in Lojban, .krtisfranks. asks that the meaning of this word be transferred wholly intact to "{boi'eu}" and that then this word be(come) unassigned.

column2: preserve formal interpretation of mekso subexpression with no substitutions made
column6: In a sense, "converts" an expression from one that has been tampered with in any way to exactly what was uttered in the first place. See: http://mw.lojban.org/papri/Proposal:_distinguishing_digits_from_numbers#Avoiding_the_.22.22D.22_Equals_.229.22.22_hole

column2: explicit "mu'o'u"-orientation marker
column6: Must be adjacent to at least one "{mu'o'u}". It 'walls off' that "mu'o'u" from applying to a quotation on the other side of this word; by the nature of "mu'o'u", this word should be elidable when two "mu'o'u"s are mutually adjacent (if this word were to be absent) or when there is no more than one quotation which is adjacent to the "mu'o'u" in question (if this word were to be absent), or when there is no "mu'o'u"; it is mandatory when it is not elidable. Example: in "lu X li'u mu'o'u lu Y li'u", it is not clear which quote (and, more specifically, which end of which quote) is being modified by "mu'o'u" - in this case, "boi'o'u" is mandatory; in "lu X li'u boi'o'u mu'o'u lu Y li'u", the "mu'o'u" applies to the quote with Y; in "lu X li'u mu'o'u boi'o'u  lu Y li'u", the "mu'o'u" applies to the quote with X; in "lu X li'u mu'o'u (boi'o'u) mu'o'u  lu Y li'u", the first "mu'o'u" applies to the quote with X, the second to the quote with Y, and this word is not necessary (marked via parenthesis).

column2: Brasilia.
$x_{1}$ (du'u) is a predicate relationship with relation $x_{2}$ among arguments (sequence/set) $x_{3}$.
column6: Also: $x_3$ are related by relation $x_2$ (= {terbri} for reordered places).  ($x_3$ is a set completely specified); See also {sumti}, {fancu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a breeze/wind/gale from direction $x_{2}$ with speed $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ blows from $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an office/bureau/work-place of worker $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects British/United Kingdom culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$j_1$=$b_1$ is almost ready for $b_2$ (event).
$x_1$ perceives that $x_2$ is the case (inference from perception).
$x_1$ (predicate) is true when applied to argument list $x_2$ (sequence)
column6: Synonymous to {zilbri}. The x1 slot can be filled with a property/relation (ka) whose number of free slots match the length of the sequence x2. It can also be filled with a bridi abstraction (du'u) —nullary predicate—, in which case the x2 should be the empty set or possibly {zi'o}. See also {bridi}.

column2: $x_1$ knows what sumti satisfies the predicate $x_2$
$x_1$ is a pro-bridi representing predicate relationship $x_2$ with relation $x_3$ among arguments $x_4$.
$x_1$ is a prenex of bridi/predicate relationship $x_2$ with relation $x_3$ among arguments $x_4$.
$l_1$ [rules/methods] is a predicate logic for deducing/concluding/inferring/reasoning to/about $l_2$ (du'u) with predicate relationships $b_1$.

$x_1$=$c_1$ (zo) is a cmavo with a predicate role or semantic structure which expresses predicate $x_2$=$b_1$ (quote/du'u) between arguments $x_3$=$b_3$ (ordered list), the said cmavo being of form or in category/class $x_4$=$c_2$ in/and belonging to language/dialect $x_5$=$c_3$.
column6: Includes "moi", "du", and any mekso cmavo for a function/operator.

column2: $x_1$ is a person who has a body that expresses predicate relationships.
$x_1$ is a bridi-tail of predicate relationship $x_2$ with relation $x_3$ among arguments (sequence/set) $x_4$.
$c_1$ is a question asking for a predicate, asked by $c_3$ to $c_4$.
column6: In Lojban, this is a question using the word “{mo}”.

column2: $x_1$ asks $x_3$ what arguments satisfy the predicate $x_2$
$x_1$ asks $x_2$ what sumti satisfies the predicate $x_3$
$x_1$ (text) represents a predicate relationship with relation represented by $x_2$ (text) among referents of $x_3$ that are arguments (sequence/set of texts).
column6: {bridi}, {selbri} and elements of {terbri} are referents of {brisni}, {selbrisni} and elements of {terbrisni} respectively.

column2: $x_1$ is a subsentence of Lojban grammar.
column6: A subsentence of the official Lojban grammar is put in NU-clause, NOI-clause or gek-gik-clause. The form is similar to a sentence of Lojban grammar, but subsentences cannot be connected to each other by afterthought connectives. See also {brisni} and {simsa}.

column2: $x_1$ induces from their auditive perception that $x_2$ is the case.
$v_1$ is a morphologically defined predicate word signifying relation $b_2$ in language $v_3$.
column6: Derived from {bridi} and {valsi}, deleting $b_3$, as we are speaking of the relationship independent of particular arguments.  In Lojban, such words must end in a vowel and contain a consonant cluster within the first five letters (not counting y).  Not all words that can be used as a selbri (for instance members of GOhA) are brivla.

column2: $c_1$ (quoted word(s)) is a name of $c_2$ used by $c_3$ that morphologically [strict] is brivla $bv_1$ in language $x_5$
column6: The name must strictly be a (sequence of) brivla (according to rules for language x5); as such, in Lojban, the word(s) c1 must end with vowels and in fact must exactly follow the morphology of brivla. See also: {brivlasmicme} (a specialization); {jvocme} (a different specialization that is analogous but restricted to Lojbanic lujvo).  Language is specified to be x5 rather than bv_n because the definition for {brivla} has not yet gained consensus and this particular terbri is dependent thereupon.

column2: $x_1$=$c_1$=$s_1$ (quoted word(s)) is a name of $x_2$=$c_2$ used by $x_3$=$c_3$ that morphologically [loose] evokes/is similar to/is a brivla $x_4$=$v_1$=$s_2$ (text; may be multiple words), similar in property/quality[/amount?] $x_5$=$s_3$ (ka/ni), in language $x_6$
column6: s3 will likely just be morphological structure. Strict brivlacme are a subclass of brivlasmicme.  The name must "look like" a (sequence of) brivla (according to rules for language x6), but need not exactly follow the morphological requirements thereof (in particular, c1 may end with a consonant in Lojban). See also: {brivlacme} (a specialization); {jvosmicme} (a different specialization that is analogous but restricted to Lojbanic lujvo).  Language is specified to be x6 rather than bv_n because the definition for {brivla} has not yet gained consensus and this particular terbri is dependent thereupon.

column2: $x_1$ is a brivla-based name for $x_2$ used by namer $x_3$
column6: {brivo} + {cmene}; see {brivla}. Syn. {brivlacme}. List of common brivycme: http://mw.lojban.org/papri/brivycme

column2: $n_1$ is Chanukkah/Hanukkah celebrated by $s_1$ with activities $s_3$

column6: This term is specific to Lojban. A “bu letteral” is defined as one word which has been made to a letteral with “{bu}”. $x_1$ is a quote (eg. with {lu}…{li'u}) containing the “bu letteral” (including “bu”), $x_2$ quotes the character which the “bu letteral” stands for verbatim, which requires to use a {zoi} quote. See also: {lerfu}.

Brunei.
Brooklyn, New York: a borough of New York City, at the western tip of Long Island.
naturalistic interjection: used to express a fit of overwhelming or uncontrollable laughter; the stereotypical 'evil laugh'
column6: Additional -'a syllables may be added as desired. See {u'i}, {le'o}, {xa'a}, {cmila}, {palci}

column2: abstractor: abstractor to create logically quantified selbri variable to be used in predicate logic of third or higher order.
column6: {zo'e} and {da} are a constant and a bound variable of predicate logic of first order respectively; {co'e} and {bu'a} are a selbri constant and a bound selbri variable of predicate logic of second order respectively; in order to express predicate logic of third or higher order, it is essential to have selbri that treat selbri variables in the domain of all selbri of second order. {su'u} and {bu'ai} in selma'o NU can compose respectively a selbri constant and a bound selbri variable in the domain of all selbri of second order. In the case that {bu'ai} takes plural number of selbri variables, connect them with {ju'e} or something. Higher order is also possible by nesting {bu'ai}. Example: su'o bu'ai xe'u kei su'o bu'a ro da zo'u bu'ai da bu'a (This {xe'u} is an abstraction-variable-indicator-{selbrisle} used in order to put a word of selma'o NU in prenex.) See also {su'u}, {bu'a}; {xe'u}.

column2: Buenos Aires.

{bu'o } - start emotion

{bu'o nai} - end emotion.
elliptical/unspecified/vague letteral/symbol
column6: Has use in mekso at the least; in this context, it might subsume {xo'e} (but see: {xo'e'o'e}). It also may be useful in spelling, initialisms, etc. If used as a pro-sumti (as other letters are), it means {zo'e} but only for reasonable or previously specified letterals assignments.

column2: Interjection: Boo!
column6: A way to shock people analogous to yelling "BOO!" at someone.

column2: $x_1$ exhibits spina di pesce/Brunelleschi herringbone (zigzag) pattern/design with features $x_2$
column6: Something as simple as the alternating count or specification of the spines can be described in x2 (in other words, the description need not be complete). See also: {zigzagi}.

attitudinal contour: 
{bu'o } - start emotion
{bu'o cu'i} - continue emotion
{bu'o nai} - end emotion.

letteral for b.

modal aspect: actuality/ongoing event.

column6: The gismu {burna} refers to objects which are brown, but not the color brown itself.  This lujvo serves the latter purpose.  See also {skari} {zilska}. EDIT: That should actually say "{bunre}", but I typed in "{burna}" because I'm an idiot.  I didn't correct it in making this edit because the irony is magnificent.

column2: $z_1$ is an awning over $z_2$, made of $b_2$.
$z_1$ is a tent inhabited by $z_2$, made of $b_2$.
$g_1$ (agent) turns device/apparatus $g_2$=$cab_1$=$can_1$ off.
column6: See also: turn on (={narca'acadgau}), turned off (={ca'arcando}).

column2: $cab_1$=$can_1$ (device/apparatus) is off / not operational.
$cl_1$ is unaided by/without apparatus/mechanism/device/equipment $ca_1$=$cl_2$ for function $ca_2$ controlled/triggered by $ca_3$ (agent).
$x_1$ (nu) happens far away in time from $x_2$ (nu).
$d_1$=$c_1$ is today; $d_1$=$c_1$ is the day occuring at the same time as $c_2$, day standard $d_3$.
$x_1$=$ce_1$=$ca_1$ is this morning; $x_1$=$ce_1$=$ca_1$ is the morning occuring at the same time as day $x_2$=$ce_2$=$d_1$ at location $x_3$=$ce_3$.
$d_1$=$c_1$=$x_1$ is the today daytime period of $c_2$=$x_2$ at location $n_3$=$x_3$.
column6: Usage rules are exactly analogous to those of "{cabycte}". This is the diurnal period which ranges from morning/sunrise until dusk/sunset for the calendrical or circadian rhythm (or similar) full day which the speaker, via $x_2$ and $x_3$, considers to be 'today'.

column2: $x_1$ (nu) happens nearby in time from $x_2$ (nu).
$j_1$=$c_1$ is this week; $j_1$=$c_1$ is the week occuring at the same time as $c_2$, week standard $j_3$.
$x_1$ overlaps in time and space with $x_2$
$m_1$=$c_1$ is the current month by month standard $m_3$, simultaneous with $c_2$ in time.
$x_1$ is a voiced bilabial stop sound produced by $x_2$.
column7: B sound;voiced bilabial plosive;voiced bilabial stop

column2: $x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'lerfu-word' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column6: Inner structure of the rule: BY | any-word BU | LAU lerfu-word | TEI lerfu-string FOI. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: $x_1$ is the boogaloo, danced by $x_2$ to music $x_3$
$x_1$ is a burger/hamburger.
$x_1$ is a bourgeois, a capitalist who engages in industrial commercial enterprise $x_2$
$x_1$ happens now
$x_1$ is modern in aspect $x_2$
digit/number: eighteen (decimal 18).
Refers to what is usually assumed to be the argument of tense tags when no explicit argument is given
column6: Usually, {pu} {ca'au} means the same as {pu} {ku}. What {ca'au} refers to depends on the bridi operators before it.

column2: time tense: has been, is now in the aftermath of; (tense/modal).
$x_{1}$ is current at/in the present of/during/concurrent/simultaneous with $x_{2}$ in time.
column6: (default $x_2$ is the present resulting in:) $x_1$ is now; time relationship only, 'aorist' claiming simultaneity does not mean one event does not extend into the past or future of the other. See also {zvati}, {balvi}, {purci}, cmavo list {ca}, cmavo list {ca'a}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is apparatus/mechanism/device/equipment for function $x_{2}$ controlled/[triggered] by $x_{3}$ (agent).
column6: Form determined by/from function; does not imply automated/automatic action - requires an external agent/trigger (a minji may be a zmiku cabra if it requires an external agent to trigger or control the functions that it performs automatically).  (cf. {tutci}, {minji}, {finti}; {girzu}, {ganzu} for organizational apparatus, {pilno})

column2: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ hours in duration (default is 1 hour) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ walks/strides/paces on surface $x_{2}$ using limbs $x_{3}$.

$x_1$ (abstraction) should/(of right) ought to be true/happening under conditions/in the case of $x_2$ being true/happening, as believed by/by standard/under consideration of $x_3$. If the world were proper/correct/just/ruled perfectly and strictly according to $x_3$ and if $x_2$ were true, then $x_1$ would be true as well.
column6: Moral judgment goes in $x_3$. $x_3$ can also be assumed by expectation under hypothesized laws of physics, by the true situation of the world, etc. Synonymous with {zgadi}.

column2: $x_1$ is a shaman/medicine man of group/tribe $x_2$
column6: Refers to the religious practices and their practitioner.

column2: $x_1$ is the $x_2$-th one timewise to satisfy property $x_3$ among $x_4$.
$n_1$ is the current year by standard $n_3$, simultaneous with $c_2$ in time.
$x_1$ is extinct/no longer existent.
$x_1$ watches the event $x_2$ unfold before their very eyes/live/red-handed/in flagrante (delicto), using senses/means $x_3$.
column6: No implication of the action being considered improper or discouraged. The event must be an action (lo nu {zukte}), not just an occurrence. "Before one's very eyes" is an idiomatic expression and does not require sight to have been involved, nor $x_1$ to even have eyes.
column7: catch in the act;in flagrante;in real time;live;red-handed

column2: $x_1$ is the last one timewise to satisfy property $x_2$ among $x_3$.
$x_1$=$v_1$=$c_1$ is this evening; $x_1$=$v_1$=$c_1$ is the evening occuring at the same time as $x_2$=$v_2$ at location $x_3$=$v_3$.
$ce_1$ is the modern era.
$n_1$=$c_1$ is the night of $c_2$ at location $n_3$.
column6: {cabycte} is tonight, whether or not it is currently night yet. {bavlamcte} is tomorrow night, even if {cabycte} is still in the future. See also {nicte}, {bavlamcte}, {prulamcte}, {cabdei}.

column2: $c_1$=$f_1$ is live (experienced as it happens) to experiencer $c_2$.
$k_1$=$c_1$ ranges through time/has duration $k_2$=$c_2$.
column6: $x_2$ is the complete duration as the amount of time or an interval specification and is non-aorist. Cf. {temci}.

column2: $x_1$ is the status quo/current state of $x_2$
$k_1$=$t_1$ is a tradition/practice/custom of traditional culture $t_2$=$k_2$ under conditions $t_3$
column6: This is similar to {ritli}, but the emphasis is not necessarily on particular rituals, but customs (ex. wearing of a particular type of clothing or hairstyle) associated with a group.

column2: $x_1$ habitually uses $x_2$ to do $x_3$; $x_1$ is a "user" of $x_2$.
$x_1$ is $x_2$ long local distance units/miles per hour (mph) in speed/velocity.
$x_1$ is $x_2$ hours in angular measure of right ascension RA (default is 1).
column6: Cf. {cacra}, {radno}, {julra'o}, {sostartai}. {pi'e} used in x2 indicates a base of 60.

column2: $c_1$=$t_2$ customarily expresses $c_2$ to $c_3$ via medium $c_4$ under conditions $t_3$.
column7: customary expression;people who say things habitually; [people who say proverbs, (though that's more like se tcacyselsku)]

column2: $cat_1$=$can_1$ is a lurker/inactively watches $cat_2$
$k_1$=$c_1$ (agent) idly plays with plaything/toy $k_2$.
$s_1$=$c_1$ (agent) ceases and rests from activity/process/state $s_2$ (not necessarily completing it).
$c_1$ is an espresso machine controlled/[triggered] by $c_3$ (agent).
$x_1$ is modern in aspect $x_2$
time tense: present actuality; modal aspect.
time tense: is now/simultaneously, is now in the middle of; (tense/modal).
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of chocolate/cocoa.
evidential: I define.
discursive / expression: "If you say so"
$x_{1}$ (event) often/frequently/commonly/customarily occurs/recurs by standard $x_{2}$.
column6: See also {rirci}, {fadni}, {kampu}, {rapli}, {krefu}, {lakne}, cmavo list {piso'iroi} and similar compounds.

column2: {catni} modal, 1st place                            by authority of ...
attitudinal: strong intensity attitude modifier.
$x_1$ is a wound on body $x_2$ at locus $x_3$ caused by $x_4$
column6: Unlike velxai, it's specific to physical injuries pertaining to the surface of an organic body such as skin. Open wounds include ka'arcagna for "incision / incised wound", fercagna for "laceration", gukcagna for "abrasion", tuncagna for "puncture wound", grecagna for "penetration wound", batcagna for "bite wound", dancagna for "gunshot wound", jelcagna for "burn", da'ercagna for "bedsore", furcagna for "necrosis"; closed wounds include daxcagna for "contusion/bruise", camdaxcagna for "hematoma", ra'ircagna for "chronic wound".

column2: $x_1$ is a binary operator which is commutative in space/under conditions/on (or endowing) set $x_2$; $x_1$ and $x_2$ are each abelian (in different senses).
column6: Denote $x_1$ by "♤"; for any elements x,y in the set of concern, if '♤' is commutative, then x♤y = y♤x, where equality is defined in the space. "Commutative property"/"commutativity" = "ka(m)( )cajni". See also: {socni}, {sezni}, {dukni}, {facni}.

column2: $x_1$ (number) is the minute/minute notation of the hour, of event/state $x_2$, in system $x_3$.
column6: {cacra} zei {mentu} zei {tcika}. As default, the number $x_1$ is counted from the first minute of the hour. See {ti'u'e} for BAI. ex.) li cino cu cacryme'utcika lo nu mi ti xrukla kei py sy ty (I will be back at thirty minutes past the hour PST.)

column2: $j_1$=$t_1$ is a convention prescribing $j_2$ (event/state) within community $j_3$=$t_2$.
$x_{1}$ is heavy in proper mass, invariant mass, rest mass, intrinsic mass
$b_1$=$c_2$ is a wind from direction $b_2$ with speed $b_3$, shoving/pushing $c_2$ at locus $c_3$.
$car_1$=$cat_2$ is a pushcart/wheelbarrow for carrying $car_2$.
$g_1$=$c_1$ pushes $m_1$=$c_2$ to destination $m_2$ from origin $m_3$ over path/route $m_4$.
$s_1$ is a valve/piston of material $s_2$, shoving/pushing $c_2$ at locus $c_3$.
$l_1$ is liquid at room temperature/at standard temperature and pressure, and consists of composition/material $l_2$.
$ca_1$=$t_1$=$cn_1$ is a/the mode [value that appears most often] in property/amount $cn_2$ (ka/ni) among $cn_3$(s) (set) by standard $cn_4$.
$r_1$ is a frequently-asked question about subject $r_2$
$x_1$ is a solid of $x_2$ at room temperature/STP.
column6: STP = standard temperature and pressure. See also {caflitki}, {cafygapci}

column2: $x_1$ is a gas of $x_2$ at room temperature/STP.
column6: STP = standard temperature and pressure. See also {caflitki}, {cafsligu}.

column2: $di_1$ is a barn for storing/sheltering grains/livestock/tools/machinery $da_1$.
$n_1$ is a pasture with vegetation $s_1$ (mainly consisting of grasses) grazed by animal(s) $d_1$ belonging to farm/ranch $c_1$.
$x_1$ is a livestock/farm-animal kept by $x_2$ of species $x_3$
$b_1$ is a bandage, plaster or compress over wound $c_1$.
$x_{1}$ is a farming community with members $x_{2}$.
$g_1$ is a/the agricultural industry/sector producing $g_2$=$c_4$ from farms $c_1$ located in $c_2$ farmed by $c_3$.
$p_1$ is a farmer associated with farm $c_1$ producing $c_4$.
$z_1$ is a farmer's market selling $z_2$, operated by farmers $z_3$=$c_3$.
$b_1$=$c_1$ is huge/enormous/colossal in property $b_2$=$c_2$ to observer $b_3$=$c_3$.
$ci1$=$ca3$ feels passionate/is emotional about/feels strongly emotion $ci2$=$ca2$ about subject/event $ci3$=$ca1$
$cp_1$=$ca_2$ demands $cp_2$=$ca_2$ from $cp_3$.
$cu_1$=$ca_1$ (agent) permits/lets/allows $cu_2$ (event) under conditions $cu_3$, derived from authority on basis $ca_3$.
$cat_1$ stares at $cat_2$ as received by observer $car_3$.
$d_1$ craves/intensely wishes $d_2$ (event/state) for purpose $d_3$.
$j_1$ is a charge of service $j_2$ to consumer $j_3$=$c_2$ set and levied by authority $j_4$=$c_1$.
$x_1$ officially/authoritatively judges $x_2$ (event/abstract)
$z_2$ is official, approved by authority $z_1$=$c_1$ over sphere/people $c_2$.

$x_1$=$v_1$ is an authoritative document of $x_2$=$v_2$ (data/facts/du'u) about $x_3$=$v_3$ (object/event) preserved in medium $x_4$=$v_4$, by authority $x_5$=$c_1$ over matter/sphere/persons $x_6$=$c_2$ derived on basis $x_7$=$c_3$.
$x_1$ is an idol
$x_1$ officially approves $x_2$ (object / event); $x_2$ is official, approved by $x_1$
$n_1$ desperately needs/is desperate for $n_2$ for purpose/action/stage of process $n_3$.
$s_1$=$c_1$ is roaring/blinding to $s_2$ via sensory channel $s_2$=$c_3$.
$g_1$ is a/the wholesale/retail industry sector in which $c_1$ trades/barters $c_2 $ for $c_3$ by process $g_3$.
$x_1$ is a hostage of / is held hostage by $x_2$
column6: Other sumti slots may be needed. See also {pinfu}.

column2: $s_1$ (set) mutually exchange/trade/barter commodity $c_2$ for $c_3$ with $c_4$.
$x_1$ is a beetle of species $x_2$.
column6: Not to be confused with {ckacinki}; Cf. {kokcinela}, {kurkuli}, {gusycinki}.

column2: $x_1$ is a mollusk/clam/mussel/snail of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is malacology based on methodology $x_2$.
$f_1$=$j_1$ is a quantity of chocolate mousse of composition including $f_2$=$c_1$=$j_2$.
$j_1$ is a quantity of chocolate pudding of composition including $c_1$=$j_2$.
$l_1$ is a chocolate drink/drinking chocolate/ is made of/contains/is a quantity of milk with added chocolate $c_1$.
$c_1$=$l_1$ is chocolate liquor, of composition including x2, under conditions x3.
$m_1$ is a quantity of/contains cocoa butter from cacao beans $m_2$.
$p_1$ is a cacao/cocoa powder/solids of cacao beans $p_2$.
$t_1$ is/are (a) cacao bean(s) of plant $sp_1$=$t_2$ (genus Theobroma; default T. cacao).
$p_1$=$j_3$=$c_3$ is mother of pearl from source $p_2$=$c_2$.
$k_1$=$c_2$ is a tank/armored combat vehicle for carrying $k_2$, propelled by $k_3$, with armor-plating $c_1$.
$x_1$ is authoritarian ideology of $x_2$; $x_2$ is authoritarian
Evidential: "because I say so"/"because I assert it to be true"/"it is known".
column6: Maybe also "because I am your parent" in some contexts. The claim is true not because the utterer defines it to be so/has the authority or ability to make it so, but instead simply because they claim it to be true. Useful for dealing with annoying children who ask "why" iteratively; not useful for actually convincing anyone of the claim.
column7: because I say so;it is known

column2: shorthand for {ca lo nu}; during the event-of
column6: People who speak the dialect that uses {ca'ei} also use {pu'ei} and {ba'ei} for {pu} {lo} {nu} and {ba} {lo} {nu} respectively. Terminates with {ku'ei}.

column2: Unary mekso operator: unit vector/normalization of the argument (vector) X.
column6: Outputs X/|X|, where X is the vector-valued input; this is the unit vector which points in the direction of X. It might generalize to other tensors and the like. The definition of the magnitude/norm/metric is left to context or the explicit definition of the space in which X lives.

column2: evidential: I don't define
$x_1$ defines $x_2$ (nu/du'u) to be true / to happen // $x_2$ is true because $x_1$ says so or thinks so.
strong scalar intensifier: extremely...
time tense: during and after; (tense/modal).
$x_1$ is a bird/reptile egg (not simply the gamete) consisting of yolk $x_2$, white $x_3$ and shell $x_4$ of species $x_5$ (default chicken).
column6: Used particularly to refer to eggs that humans tend to eat, particularly chicken eggs, which is why the species place comes so late. Places for the major parts of the egg are included to make terms for "egg yolk" "egg white" and "egg shell".

column2: Now. At the present time.
column6: The terminator {ku} is used to close the tense {ca}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a shell/husk [hard, protective covering] around $x_{2}$ composed of $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ vanishes/disappears from location $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ ceases to be observed at $x_{2}$ using senses/sensor $x_{3}$.
column6: Also leaves, goes away (one sense).  See also {cliva}, {ganse}, {zgana}, {lebna}, {vimcu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is idle/at rest/inactive.
column6: “in motion”, not implying a change in location, is negation of this: {narcando}. See also {surla}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a farm/ranch at $x_{2}$, farmed by $x_{3}$, raising/producing $x_{4}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is agrarian.
column6: Also grange; farming is any organized agrarian activity, not limited to plant crops.  See also {purdi}, {nurma}, {ferti}, {foldi}, {xarju}.

column2: $x_{1}$ exchanges/trades/barters commodity $x_{2}$ for $x_{3}$ with $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$, $x_{4}$ is a trader/merchant/businessman.
column6: Also (adjective:) $x_1$, $x_2$, $x_4$ is/are commercial (better expressed as ka canja, {kamcanja}).  $x_2$/$x_3$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event (possibly service), or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posycanja} for unambiguous semantics); (cf. {dunda}, {friti}, {vecnu}, {zarci}, {jdini}, {pleji}, {jdima}, {jerna}, {kargu}; see note at {jdima} on cost/price/value distinction, {banxa}, {cirko}, {dunda}, {janta}, {kargu}, {prali}, {sfasa}, {zivle})

column2: $x_{1}$ is a window/portal/opening [portal] in wall/building/structure $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is space/volume/region/room [at-least-3-dimensional area] occupied by $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a shovel/spade [bladed digging implement] for digging $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of sand/grit from source $x_{2}$ of composition including $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the gut(s)/entrails/intestines/viscera/innards/digestive system [body-part] of $x_{2}$.
interval event contour: during ...; continuative                                    |-----|.
$x_1$=$d_1$ is an armoured fighter protected by armuor/shell $x_2$=$c_1$ covering $x_3$=$c_2$ of material $x_4$=$c_3$
column6: From {calku} (shell/armour) and {damba} (fighter). Does not imply full body armour.

column2: $j_1$ is a crustacean of species/class $j_2$.
$x_1$ is a turtle of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a calabash (hard-shelled gourd) of species or variety $x_2$
$x_1$ is voluminous by standard or relatively to $x_2$ (plural)

$c_1$=$d_1$=$m_1$ (space/volume/region/room) is $d_2$=$m_2$ cubic decimetres/decimeters ($m^3$) measured in perpendicular directions (triple)/defined by set of points (set)/occupied by $c_2$=$m_3$ by standard $m_4$.
$c_1$=$t_1$ is space-time occupied by $c_2$.
$x_1$ is a voxel of model/object $x_2$
$x_1$ is the geometric shape of $x_2$
$cm_1$ is a geometry describing $cm_2$=$ca_1$=$t_1$ geometric object.
$x_1$ is shaped (physically/geometrically) like $x_2$, with shape $x_3$
$p_1$ is a hologram/holograph on surface $p_2$ or projected from radiation source $g_3$ ; $p_1$ is holographic
$c_1$=$m_1$ (space/volume/region/room) is $m_2$ cubic metres/meters ($m^3$) measured in perpendicular directions (triple)/defined by set of points (set)/occupied by $c_2$=$m_3$ by standard $m_4$.
sumti question asking for a time/date/event; simultaneous with what?.
$x1$ is white
column6: Does not include the case when x1 is very-light colored but not white, narrower than {blabi}.

column2: $cp_1$=$ca_1$ demands $cp_2$ from $cp_3$.
$g_1$=$c_1$ is vast/very wide in (2nd most significant) dimension $g_2$=$c_2$ with observer $g_3$=$c_3$.
$g_1$ is intensely happy about $g_2$.
$x_1$ concentrates on / pays close attention to $x_2$
$k_1$=$c_1$ screams/howls sound $k_2$.
$x_1$ loves (emphatically likes) $x_2$ (object/state)
column6: Made to include a use of the English word "love" that zo {prami} doesn't cover

column2: $c_1$=$p_1$ intensely loves/feels strong affectionate devotion towards $p_2$ (object/state).
$ci_1$ is a fan of/intensely interested in $ci_2$ as received/measured by observer $ca_3$.
$g_1$ is a fanclub for $g_2$=$ci_2$.
$ci_1$=$m_2$ is toucan/toucanet of species/type $ci_2$ with bill $m_1$=$s_1$ of typically intense color or colors $s_2$=$ca_1$
$c_1$ effortfully tries to do $t_2$ by method $t_3$, as perceived by $c_3$.
$x_1$ is scarlet
$x_1$ is silicon.
$d1$ desires/wants/wishes vanishing/disappearance of $c1$ (event/state) for purpose $d3$.
$d_1$ is a sandbag with sand $d_2$=$c_1$, made of material $d_3$.
$x1$ is a hourglass measuring time units $x2$ to precision $x3$
$c_1$=$u_1$ is a window of user interface $u_2$.
$x_1$ is silicon (Si)
$r_1$=$c_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of sandstone of type/composition $r_2$=$c_3$ from location/source $r_3$=$c_2$.
$x_1$ is a sand desert
$g_1$ disembowels $c_2$=$b_2$.
$r_1$ defenestrates $r_2$ through window/portal/opening [portal] $c_1$ in wall/building/structure $c_2$
$g_1$ is a window frame of window $g_2$=$c_1$.
$x_1$ feels insecurity / feels threatened by threat $x_2$
$l_1$ is an adventurer traveling via route $l_2$ using means/vehicle $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a volleyball.
$x_1$ is arranged and to be traced/read in boustrophedon manner, starting at point $x_2$, turning at points $x_3$ (ordered list), and ending at point $x_4$.
column6: $x_1$ need not be a script (for example: it could just be a winding curve/maze/path/pattern, a snake curled up withoutcoiling on top of itself, or yarn while weaving or on a loom). If not orientation is preferred, then $x_2$ and $x_4$ may be mutually exchangeable if the $x_3$ is reversed. See also: {toxsotiseira}.

column2: $x_1$ is the Boltzmann $k_B$ constant linking energy with temperature [approximately equal to: 1.380 6488(13)×$10^{−23}$ J/K], expressed in units $x_2$ (default: unitless/dimensionless and equal to 1) in paradigm/system/metaphysics/universe $x_3$ (default: this, our actual, physical universe)
column6: Introduced by Planck (along with "h", his own eponymous constant); named after Boltzmann who nonetheless laid the foundation for research into such affairs. See also: {stefanboltsemasi} ($sigma_{SB}$), {plankexu}, {tcelerita}, {gravnutnoia}, {avgadro}, {ocnerta}, {nejni}, {kelvo}, {nilgla}.

column2: $x_1$ punches $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a member of insect genus Bombyx [silkworms] of subtaxon/type/species/breed $x_2$
$x_1$ is a light bulb
column6: light bulb is an evacuated glass bulb producing light

column2: $x_1$ is a femur, thigh bone of $x_2$
$x_1$ is a ethmoid bone (os ethmoidale) performing function $x_2$ in body of $b_3$.
$b_1$ is a/the lacrimal bone (os lacrimale) performing function $b_2$ in body of $b_3$.
$b_1$ is a/the palate bone performing function $b_2$ in body of $b_3$.
$x_1$ is a bonsai/dwarfed art tree of species/variety $x_2$ in style/with other properties $x_3$
$b_1$ is a moka pot for coffee $b_2$, made of material $b_3$ with lid $b_4$.
$b_1$ is a percolator for coffee $b_2$, made of material $b_3$ with lid $b_4$.
column6: See also: coffeemaker (={kafpraca'a}). For the filter add fifth place (=fi'o julne: x5).

column2: $bo_1$ is a porcelain bottle/jar/urn/flask/closable container made of porcelain for $bo2_2$ with lid $bo_4$.
$x_1$ bribes $x_2$ to $x_3$ for $x_4$ (ka)
$x_1$ is a bra or ket (mathematical object/notation) meaning/denoting/representing  (object/information) $x_2$ with properties $x_3$
column6: The definition treats bras and kets on equal footing, without distinction (except possibly by x3).

column2: $x_1$ is Breton in aspect $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a patent on invention $x_2$ by inventor $x_3$ valid in jurisdiction $x_4$ for time interval $x_5$.
$x_1$ (text) is an abbreviation, short form of word or phrase $x_2$ (text)
column6: Newer version of the obsolete form {brevia}.

column2: $x_1$ is the relationship between $x_2$, $x_3$, $x_4$, ...
column6: ko'a mo ko'e ko'i ... = "ma brididu ko'a ko'e ko'i ...", which is the way that English expresses the concept of Lojban {mo}. See also {bridi}, {du'u}, {mo}.

column2: $x_1$ is a quantity of Brie cheese of variety $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'bridi-tail' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column6: Inner structure of the rule: bridi-tail-1 (gihek stag? KE # bridi-tail /KEhE#/ tail-terms)?. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: $x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'sentence' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column6: Inner structure of the rule: (terms (CU #)?)? bridi-tail. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: mekso 4-nary operator: spherical harmonics on colatitudinal/polar angle $a$ and azimuthal/longitudinal angle $b$ of unassociated order $c$ and associated order $d$.
column6: Usually denoted $Y^m_l (\theta, \phi)$. The Condon-Shortley phase must be prepended to the definition. The normalization is chosen so that the integral over all (solid) angles of $Y^m_l(\Omega) conj(Y^n_k(\Omega))  = \delta(m,n) \delta(l,k)$.

column2: binary operator: complex number from argument and phase, $(r, \phi) \mapsto r e^{i \phi}$
column6: For example, {re} {ca'oi} {pai} is −2, and {pa} {ca'oi} {vei} {pai}{fe'i}{vo} is about 0.7071 + 0.7071i.

column2: elliptical/unspecified truth value; "maybe, maybe not"
column6: {cau'i}, but in NA. Indicates unspecificity or uncertainty between {ja'a} and {na}. See {cau'e}.

column2: begin lines of serial dialogue
column6: Usually, the user should immediately precede this word by ".{i}{ni'o}". This word introduces a dialogue or series of utterances/expressions, which will usually be unmarked for speaker (although subscripting is available), in a free-floating structure; the result is essentially like an assertion that the subsequent dialogue took place (from the standpoint of needing a selbri for a grammatical expression). Only quotations, text, "{sedu'u}" expressions, "{lu'e}" concepts or similar may be enclosed in the structure which is introduced by this word, ignoring subscripts and parentheticals and similar. The lines of dialogue which constitute the elements enclosed by the produced structure function as in and are serialized as described by the open-ended terbri tail of "{tcasnuue}" (id est: tcasnuue$_i$ for $i > 6$). Use this word in a transcript, or in a book when discussing fast-pased dialogue in which specifying speaker is not necessary/desired and would break the flow, etc. This word/the structure produced thereby is terminated by "{ca'u'o}". The structure is not intended to modify any other constructions and should typically be immediately followed by ".{i}{ni'o}".

column2: elliptical/unspecified scalar modifier: "maybe, maybe not", modifies next selbri-unit or tag
column6: {cau'i}, but in NAhE. Shortened from {cau'o'e}. See {cau'a}.

column2: modifier / discursive: elliptical affirmative; "maybe, maybe not"
column6: Elliptical NAI/CAI. "Maybe yes, maybe no, maybe somewhere in between". Can also modify attitudinals: {uicau'i} = "Maybe I'm happy, maybe I'm sad". See {ju'ocu'i}, {ju'acu'i}, {ju'oinai}, {cau'a}, {cau'e}, {na'i}, {ge'e}

column2: Terminate "ca'u'e" construct.
column6: Elidable terminator; seldom actually elidable in practice, except at the end of text. See: "{ca'u'e}".

column2: elliptical/vague/indecisive scalar affirmer/negator; true neutral/non-committed/uninvolved scalar truthfulness/assertion.
column6: Useful for when the truthfulness or falseness of a bridi is undesirable (the speaker makes no firm stance or assumption on the matter). Different from "{no'e}" in that it does not necessarily select a neutral value on a scale; it merely acknowledges that some value on the scale could be chosen/that the scale exists, but does not choose one (it is hands-off). If one does not want to accuse someone of being or doing something, but wants to talk about it, this word would be used; often can be used for "are or are not". It does not necessarily imply uncertainty or leading/implicit or rhetorical device/assertion/assumption/question.

column2: lambda variable prenex; marks the end of introduction of lambda-scope variables.
column6: Cf. {zo'u}. In effect this word is used as a shortcut around verbose repeated assignment in a {ka} prenex: lo ka ce'u goi ko'a ce'u goi ko'e ... zo'u ... is the same as lo ka ko'a ko'e ... ce'ai ... In either form this style can be used to avoid subscripting and to disambiguate nested {ka}, {ni}, etc.

column2: Formulates periodic ordered list of exactly the connectands in the order presented.
column6: Links together conmectands in a single list until connectives end or get interrupted (say, by a higher-precedent different connective); so "x1 ce'au x2 ce'au x3" produces a single ordered list of period three of form "x1, x2, x3, x1, x2, x3, x1, ... [etc.]". If the list has a natural or known definitive initial state/element (but no such terminating one), then it is the first element which is mentioned; likewise, if the list has a natural or known definitive terminating state/element (but no such initial one), then it is the last item/connectand explicitly mentioned and linked by this word into the same list; both of these are semi-infinite cases. Finite cases have no pressuposed beginning or end state/item. This word is agnostic on whether the list is finite (only finitely many repetitions naturally/are known to occur; arbitrarily many periods/cycles or otherwise), semi-infinite (infinitely many repetitions occur, but there is a definitive start or end state which is natural or known to occur; it is also agnostic, in this case, about which of these options is the applicable one), or doubly-infinite (extends in both directions infinitely; infinitely many cycles, no definitive beginning or end). If exactly two items are linked into the list in total, then the list is 2-periodic: it alternates between the two items (back-and-forth); examples of this would be "on and off" (describing, say, a flickering light), "right, left, right, left, ..." (describing walking), etc. Having exactly three items in the list will produce a list which is 3-periodic and 'rotates' through the items cyclically in order; an example of this would be a description of traffic light signals ("green, yellow, red, green, yellow, red, green, ..."); it does not oscillate/swing back and forth between the explicit 'period endpoints' (so, NOT "green, yellow, red, yellow, green, yellow, red, yellow, green, ..."). See also: {je}, {ce}, {fa'u}.

column2: BIhI argument modifier: indicates dimensionality/length of tuple
column6: Followed immediately by a nonnegative integer n (which is no less than the length of the nearby argument) without "li" prefacing it; otherwise, it is terminated and the (implicit/elided) number assumed is {za'u} {pa}. The argument is understood to be a point/formal tuple in a space of at least the 'dimensionality' described by n. Its exact behavior depends on context (for example: being next to a formal tuple versus next to a point in, say, a geometric space).  See: https://mw.lojban.org/index.php?title=Extended_Dimensionality_of_Interval_cmavo

column2: $x_1$ is the year / era of years indicated by PA (digit string) in calendar system $x_2$
column6: In the PA string, use PA4 digits as blanks to refer to time ranges. For example: "lo pasobixo'e cei'a" is the eighties (198X years), "lo pamuso'ixo'e cei'a" is the late 16th century (high 15XX years). x1 is an event or concept.

column2: define following selbri with sentence or tu'e...tu'u clause
column6: Usage: The selbri after {cei'e} is defined by the associated sentence or {tu'e}...{tu'u} clause. {bo'a}, {bo'e}, {bo'i}, {bo'o}, and {bo'u} represent places $x_1$ through $x_5$ within its place structure. (Use {bo'ai} for more places if needed, or {ce'u} for "next place"). // {cei'e} is meant to be used to define new words (implicit {ca'e}) but may be modified by evidentials to express an assertion ({ju'a}) or opinion ({pe'i}) on a meaning instead. Alternatively, {smuni} and {ka'ei} may be used. // See {cei}, {goi}, {goi'e}

column2: pro-bridi: the universal predicate
column6: True for all values. See also: {zai'o} (pro-sumti; empty), {gai'o} (pro-bridi; empty), {mai'i} (pro-sumti; universal), {ctaipe}.

column2: extracts an element from a set, category, class, group, collection, organization, system, etc.
column6: The following word should be a set, category, or class; the result is some element which belongs thereto. Approximately equivalent to "lo cmima be [following sumti]".

column2: argument list separator: acts as a comma between arguments in an argument list supplied to a function.
column6: ce'oi is the word of choice to separate the arguments in $bridi_3$. Using {ce'o} there has obvious limitations when the selbri actually calls for a sequence. Obviously, ce'oi has issues too if the selbri can accept an argument list, but this can be circumvented more readily with {ke}...{ke'e} brackets than it can with {ce'o}. Consider ".i lo ka broda cu selbri fi ko'a ce'o ko'e". Without inspecting the type requirements of {broda} and the respective types of {ko'a} and {ko'e}, one cannot determine the meaning of the {bridi}. Furthermore, if one accepts non-static typing of {sumti} places, multiple correct answers can be given for a question asking what is the $bridi_1$. This would create ambiguity that is otherwise resolved by "ce'oi". See also {ka}, {du'u}, {me'au}

column2: metadata tag / hashtag
column6: Hashtags are very common in written Lojban conversations. This cmavo makes them pronouncable, thereby opening them up for verbal communication.

column2: discursive: marks an utterance as using something that is experimental/not official, especially experimental grammar
column6: In some sense, functions as an error marker or an error quote (but without the quote).

column2: Mekso unary or binary operator: $n$-set or integer interval; in unary form, it maps a nonnegative integer $X_1 = n$ to the set $\{1, \dots , n\}$ (fully, officially, and precisely: the intersection of (a) the set of exactly all positive integers with (b) the closed ordered interval [$1, n$] such that $n \geq 1$; see notes for other $n$); in binary form, it maps ordered inputs $(X_1, X_2) = (m, n)$ to the intersection of (a) the set of exactly all integers with (b) the closed ordered interval [$m, n$].
column6: $0$ on its own induces the unary form of this word and thus maps to the empty set ∅. Inputting infinity (for the unary form) produces the set of exactly all positive integers (sometimes also onown as: natural numbers), $Z^{+} = N$. The upper bound is always specified; when the lower bound is not specified, it defaults to $1$ and the upper bound must equal or exceed $1$ (else the output is ∅). If this word is represented by $f$, and $Z$ represents the set of exactly all integers, and $(n, m \in Z \cup$ Set$(\pm \infty$)$: m \leq n)$, then: $f(m, n) = Z \cap [m, n]$, and furthermore: if $1 \leq n$, then $f(n) = f(1, n) = Z \cap [1, n]$, else $f(n) =$ ∅. The definition extends naturally (and with only trivial modification) to non-integer real-valued $n, m$, but it is recommended to keep them as integers when possible. $Z$ excludes $\pm \infty$.

column2: mekso 4-nary operator: spherical harmonics on colatitudinal/polar angle $a$ and azimuthal/longitudinal angle $b$ of unassociated order $c$ and associated order $d$.
column6: Usually denoted $Y^m_l (\theta, \phi)$. The Condon-Shortley phase must be prepended to the definition. The normalization is chosen so that the integral over all (solid) angles of $Y^m_l(\Omega) conj(Y^n_k(\Omega)  = \delta(m,n) \delta(l,k)$.

column2: $t_1$ kneels on surface $t_2$ on limb $c_2$=$x_3$ of body $c_3$=$x_4$.
$x_1$ kneels/genuflects with meaning $x_2$ on surface $x_3$ on/with limb(s) $x_4$ of body $x_5$.
column6: Usually implies obeisance, homage, devotion, loyalty, obedience, subservience, vulnerability, or some other form of inferiority or trust. Specify the recipient of said inferiority or trust expression via/in $x_2$. Mere "{cidytse}" is an action which may not convey any semantic information; cidytsecorci refers to a strict/proper subset of actions which are cidytse. This word uses experimental rafsi "-coc-", which has been proposed to be assigned to experimental gismu "{corci}". This word is, for now, equivalent to "{cocyborcidytse}", mostly because .krtisfranks. cannot semantically distinguish between "a kneeling-type-of semantic-gesture" and "a semantic-gesture-type-of kneeling".

column2: quotes an emoji name surrounded by pauses; can be non-Lojban
transfnite cardinal beth
number: uncountably infinite of some sort or infinite in the sense of satisfying the Generalized Continuum Hypothesis.
column6: An infinite cardinality which is not countable (aleph-0); if the Generalized Continuum Hypothesis (GCH) is rejected, meaning that the only infinite cardinalities are those of aleph-n form (for nonnegative integer n), then this word would incorporate all uncountable infinities (aleph-m for any strictly positive integer m); else, it incorporates those and any infinity which is strictly larger than aleph-0.

column2: Digit string: aleph-nought, aleph-0, the cardinality of the natural (alternatively: integer) numbers
tense interval modifier: countably infinitely many times; objectively quantified tense; defaults as time tense.
column6: Not necessarily discrete or unbounded in time, nor (eventually or otherwise) infinitely frequent; as a set of Lebesgue measure 0, it is definitely not "always" ({roroi}) in most contexts. For a less specific form of "infinitely many times", use "{ci'iroi}". For the R type of uncountably infinitely many times, use "{ci'iparoi}".

mekso operator (binary): projection function; the Bth term/entry ("element") of tuple A
column6: A must be a tuple. Let L = length(A); then L is a positive integer, 0, or infinity (countable), and  A = (A_1, A_2, ..., A_L), and B must be a natural number and belong to the ordered interval [1, L]. If L = 0, the output is a placeholder "blank element"; else, if B does not satisfy the aforementioned condition, then the function is undefined. Using the aforementioned notation, and letting Proj represent the projection function, Proj(A, B) = A_B; note that B = 1 will cause the output of the first entry in the tuple, which is A_1. For any i, there is no restriction on the typing/value of A_i so long as it is defined; the type of A_i need not even match the type of A_j for i =/= j. See also: {bai'ei}, {no'au'au}, {pi'ei}. Notice that the input is a single tuple and an integer, it does not rely on anyou underlying stucture; this is markedly different from a the dot product of vectors, although by establishing a basis and an underlying field, they can look quite similar.

$c_3$=$u_1$ is a text field with text $c_2$ in user interface $u_2$.
column6: May be a single-line text field or a multiple-line text field. See {pejypoici'a zei uidje}, {uidje}.

column2: $x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'bridi-tail-3' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column6: Inner structure of the rule: selbri tail-terms | gek-sentence. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: $x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'statement-3' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column6: Inner structure of the rule: sentence | tag? TUhE # text-1 /TUhU#/. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: $x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'operand-3' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column6: Inner structure of the rule: quantifier | lerfu-string /BOI#/ | NIhE # selbri /TEhU#/ | MOhE # sumti /TEhU#/ | JOhI # mex-2+ /TEhU#/ | gek operand gik operand-3 | (LAhE # | NAhE BO #) operand /LUhU#/. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: $x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'sumti-3' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column6: Inner structure of the rule: sumti-4 ((ek joik) stag? BO # sumti-3)?. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: $x_1$ is tripedal; $x_1$ has three legs
$x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'selbri-3' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column6: Inner structure of the rule: selbri-4+. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: $x_1$ (word / me'ei-predicate / si'o-concept) means whatever speaker $x_2$ wants it to mean
column7: means whatever I want it to mean

column2: $b_1$ is a false banana/ensete [plant/fruit] of species/breed $b_2$.
$x_1$ (usually Lojban word) is the BAI cmavo corresponding to root word/gismu $x_2$.
column6: Example: "zo bai baicmvo zo bapli". In general, "fi'o [le se baicvmo] fe'u" must be grammatically equivalent to [le baicmvo". Other criteria for other Lojban-related languages apply as required. See also {bai}, {cmavo}.

column2: $x_1$ is an executable/binary file to be run in system/runtime environment $x_2$.
column6: A calque on the English word "binary". The $x_1$ refers more generally to executables, not necessarily binaries. This includes shell scripts and interpreted languages such as Python. The $x_2$ refers to runtime environments, which can be operating systems or more general environments such as virtual machines like the JVM. See also {samrkompli}, which is specifically about compiled programs.

column2: $x_1$ is measured in $x_2$ (default 1) bytes (unit of data/information, = 8 bits)
column6: See {skami}, {datni}, {bitnymei}, {bitni} // Decimal prefixed forms (powers of 1000): {ki'orbaitni} {megbaitni} {gigbaitni} {tetybaitni} {petybaitni} {xexybaitni} {zepybaitni} {gotybaitni} // Binary prefixed forms (powers of 1024): {kirbibaitni} {merbibaitni} {girbibaitni} {terbibaitni} {perbibaitni} {xerbibaitni} {zerbibaitni} {gorbibaitni}

column2: $x_1$ is a budgerigar (Melopsittacus undulatus) of breed $x_2$
$x_1$ is a zebu/Bos indicus of species/subspecies $x_2$
$b_1$ is a bison/wisent (genus Bison) of species/breed $b_2$.

$b_1$ is a gaur/Indian bison (Bos gaurus) of species/breed $b_2$.
$x_1$ is a baldaquin
$x_1$ pertains to/reflects the culture/politics/geography/history of the Balkans (subregion of or neighboring region to Southeastern Europe) in aspect $x_2$.
column6: This word does not mean "Balkanized", which deserves a separate brivla (probably a lujvo).

column2: $x_1$ is a baleen whale of species $x_2$

$x_1$ (text, image, page element) is infra/later-mentioned/subsequently mentioned/later/following/below/toward the bottom of the page/screen (flat and primarily two-dimensional display) relative to $x_2$ (text, image, page element) on page/screen/in work $x_3$ according to cultural convention $x_4$.
column6: Because text is usually read horizontally, this word could mean "to the right of" (for left-to-right writing) or "to the left of" (for right-to-left writing), as assessed on each given line; additionally, any horizontal direction within the plane of the display can contribute a nonzero component, so long as $x_1$ is also bottomward of $x_2$. For texts/writing systems which begin at the bottom of a page (according to physical orientation), then this word refers to the opposite direction instead of the physical bottom of the page. In other words, this word always is oriented forward along the writing/display which, by cultural convention, the user should have not yet consumed (in this iteration of consumption, Okazaki style). Can refer to distinct subsequent pages. Essentially, the entire document is imagined as being displayed upon a single, arbitrarily-long, ordered screen which is wide enough to display at most a single word/character or element per line throughout; in this configuration, $x_1$ follows and is perforce 'below' $x_2$. $x_3$ can also refer to a website/webpage or any piecewise linearly-directed display or medium in which the locally-surrounding content is simultaneously displayed (so, videos which display frames over the course of time would be excluded as a whole, but any one of such frames may be included). See also: "{galprurci}" (opposite), "{balvidzita zei farna}".

column2: $x_1$ (sequence) is the number range going from number $x_2$ up to number $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ reflects the Xin Dynasty culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ inscribes/writes $x_2$ in Hokkien POJ (Pe̍h-ōe-jī) on display/storage medium $x_3$ with writing implement $x_4$.
column6: 白话字/白話字/Pe̍h-ōe-jī; Chinese Hokkien "Church Romanization" writing or POJ

column2: $x_1$ is a Pythagorean tuning with $x_2$ (default infinitely many) notes and a generator fifth of size $x_3$ (default 3/2), containing a wolf fifth of size $x_4$ (default none, unless number of notes specified).
column6: With its default fifth size, this word is synonymous to "cuvytonci'e li ci", 3-limit just intonation; but this word can also refer to tunings with different sizes of the fifth, including meantone tunings.

column2: $x_1$ is the minor key (natural minor/Aeolian) of tonic $x_2$ of / with type / notes $x_3$.
$x_1$ is the major key of tonic $x_2$ of/with type/notes $x_3$.
$x_1$ (system) is a deterministic dynamic system displaying chaotic/extreme input-sensitivity in property/aspect $x_2$ with characteristics (parts, relations, manner, output, etc.) $x_3$
column6: Some definitions of "Chaos" require that the system must be deterministic and dynamic, sensitive to initial conditions, display/develop topologically mixing (in some subset of its phase space), have dense periodic orbits.

column2: $x_1$ is Kafkaesque to $x_2$ in property $x_3$ (ka).

column6: Original café au lait (x2=lo {fraso}), European variants (x2=lo {ropno}), American variants (x2=lo {bemro}), New Orleans variant (x2=la {nu,orlins}). For non-cultural specific usage: coffee with hot milk (={glaladyckafi}).

column2: $x_1$ is a quantity of Whisky coffee of composition $x_2$ (including whisky/whiskey/bourbon).
column6: See also: liqueur coffee (={jikryckafi}), Gaelic/Highland/Irish coffee (={kotyjikryckafi}).

column2: Having property $x_1$ is frequent, common among what has property $x_2$.

Define $x_1$ to be a named dummy symbol (having a name heretofore unassigned) such that, if it were to exist, it would satisfy condition/have property $x_2$ (condition/ka); let $x_1$ be such that it satisfies/is described by $x_2$.
column6: This is not a standard assertion/claim proposition, instead being an assignment statement/directive (has an implicit "{ko}"); as such, it does not really have a truth value (or its truth value is TRUE because of itself). A thing such as $x_1$ need not exist, although non-existence is also not implied; this bridi abstains from resolving the question of $x_1$'s existence. "{ca'e}", "{ckaji}", "{da}", "{poi}", "{zo'u}".
column7: define x such that;existential instantiation;let x be such that
